intro: Cyanodaphne tomentosa, commonly known as the woolly blueberry, is a species of flowering plant in the family Myrtaceae. It is native to Australia and is characterized by its small, blue-black berries and dense, woolly foliage. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy soils. It produces small white flowers that bloom in spring, followed by its edible fruits. Cyanodaphne tomentosa is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine.
